content: the moss stitch squares blanket showcases the timeless moss stitch moss stitch is used for the squares the joining technique and the border the blanket is made up of 49 individual squares arranged in a 7 by 7 formation each square has 14 rounds with 13 rounds completed before using the join-as-you-go joining method on the 14th round to seamlessly connect them gauge 8 rounds made as per pattern below = 10cm/4in the gauge is not critical for this project but it may affect yarn quantities and the finished size might be different than stated finished size approximately 118cm x 118cm 46 5in x 46 5in an ad-free pdf version digital download of this pattern is available to buy now from ravelry this pdf is 39 pages long and has step-by-step progress photos on pages 1-32 like the free version on my blog it also includes just the written pattern on pages 33-39 with minimal photos and diagrams for those who do not want lots of photos to print out there are supporting videos available for the moss stitch squares and the join-as-you-go-joining method this pattern is free on my website https //thecrochetswirl com/moss-stitch-squares-blanket/
